intro: Reichantha jorge-warneri, commonly known as the Warner's Reichantha, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats at high altitudes. Its flowers are small and white to pale green, often clustered in dense, spherical heads. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
